(b) Mudslides will remain a threat for the next few days because the heavy rains have already saturated the soil and increased the risk of further mudslides.

Option (a) simply states that mudslides will remain a threat, while option (b) provides additional information explaining why mudslides will remain a threat.

In this case, option (b) is not adding any new information that changes the likelihood of the event, but rather providing a reason to support the claim. The probability of mudslides remaining a threat does not change with the added explanation.

Therefore, I would select:

(a) Mudslides will remain a threat for the next few days

As the correct answer.
